page.title: 09BLOODY CORNER
page.content: Many histories tell about Hunna the Dane invading "Cynuit Castle". There is a tradition that Cynuit is Kenwith Castle near Abbotsham. Hubba landed in Appledore Bay and went upto Northam and onto Kenwith, where he laid seige to the castle. The Danes thought the castle had no water supply and so they believed the people inside would have to surrender. But the Saxons in Kenwith managed to break-out, surprising the Danes who had to flee for their ships. In a skirmish during the reatreat, it is said that Hubba was killed at a spot now called 'Bloody Corner', where a plague commemorates the event, but there is no other evidence that this is true.
